title: 115_s1091
content: The "Supporting Grandparents Raising Grandchildren Act" acknowledges the increasing number of grandparents caring for their grandchildren due to factors like the opioid epidemic. Placement with relatives is preferred over foster care for children who cannot safely remain with their parents. The percentage of grandparents caring for their grandchildren increased from 24% in 2006 to 32% in 2016. Grandparents report benefits but may struggle with their own health needs. Better coordination of resources is needed to support them. An Advisory Council is established to support grandparents raising grandchildren. An Advisory Council is established to support grandparents and older relatives raising grandchildren, with members including key government officials and representatives of relevant agencies. The Advisory Council, led by the Department of Health and Human Services, is responsible for providing information, resources, and best practices to help grandparents and older relatives raising children meet their needs and maintain their own well-being, including considering the impact of opioids. The Advisory Council, under the Department of Health and Human Services, must address the needs of those affected by the opioid crisis and members of Native American tribes. Within 180 days of the Act's enactment, the Council must submit a report to relevant committees, state agencies responsible for family caregiver programs, and the public, containing best practices and resources for grandparents and older relatives raising children. The Advisory Council must submit a follow-up report within 2 years of the initial report, including information on gaps in addressing the needs of children impacted by the opioid epidemic and any additional legislative authority required. The report will be sent to appropriate committees and state agencies responsible for family caregiver programs. The Advisory Council will establish a process for public input to gather information on best practices and resources for grandparents and older relatives raising children. This outreach will seek input on available information, resources, and any unmet needs in this area. The Advisory Council to Support Grandparents Raising Grandchildren will gather information on best practices and resources for older relatives caring for children, make recommendations to meet their needs, and maintain their well-being. The Council is exempt from the Federal Advisory Committee Act, no additional funds are authorized, and it will terminate three years after enactment. The term "appropriate committees" in the Act refers to specific committees in the Senate and House of Representatives. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
